Sentencas: The performance of advanced functional materials for fuel cell applications are closely linked to the material composition and morphology at the micro and nano-scales.
Titulo: Multi-scale 3D imaging of absorbing porous materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: 3D characterization techniques that can provide bulk information at these fine scales are therefore essential for microstructure optimization of these materials.
Titulo: Multi-scale 3D imaging of absorbing porous materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here, the X-ray nano-holotomography technique is used to image various multi-phase and absorbing solid oxide fuel cell electrodes.
Titulo: Multi-scale 3D imaging of absorbing porous materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Different porous structures for typical commercial cells and innovative electrode designs obtained using a freeze-casting process are studied.
Titulo: Multi-scale 3D imaging of absorbing porous materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Taking advantage of the geometrical setup and the use of high energy X-rays, both large reconstructions (field of view: 150 A mu m) and local tomography at higher resolution (field of view: 50 A mu m) can be performed on the same sample to have a multi-scale approach.
Titulo: Multi-scale 3D imaging of absorbing porous materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This produces highly representative sample volumes with a size/resolution ratio that allows the geometric and physical properties of the materials to be calculated, e.g., connectivity of each phase, mean particles diameters, specific surface area, particle size distributions, tortuosity factors, and densities of triple boundary lengths.
Titulo: Multi-scale 3D imaging of absorbing porous materials for solid oxide fuel cells
